segments.en: Linked Discourses 12
7. The Great Chapter
68. At Kosambī

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca musilo āyasmā ca paviṭṭho āyasmā ca nārado āyasmā ca ānando kosambiyaṃ viharanti ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time the venerables Musīla, Saviṭṭha, Nārada, and Ānanda were staying near Kosambī in Ghosita’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā paviṭṭho āyasmantaṃ musilaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Saviṭṭha said to Venerable Musila:

segments.pli: “aññatreva, āvuso musila, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato musilassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
segments.en: “Reverend Musila, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, do you know for yourself that
rebirth is a condition for old age and death?”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
segments.en: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, I know and see that
rebirth is a condition for old age and death.”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso musila, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato musilassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
segments.en: “Reverend Musila, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, do you know for yourself that
continued existence is a condition for rebirth …
grasping is a condition for continued existence …
craving is a condition for grasping …
feeling is a condition for craving …
contact is a condition for feeling …
the six sense fields are conditions for contact …
name and form are conditions for the six sense fields …
consciousness is a condition for name and form …
choices are a condition for consciousness …
ignorance is a condition for choices?”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
segments.en: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, I know and see that
ignorance is a condition for choices.”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso musila, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato musilassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
segments.en: “Reverend Musila, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, do you know for yourself that
when rebirth ceases, old age and death cease?”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
segments.en: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, I know and see that
when rebirth ceases, old age and death cease.”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso musila, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato musilassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
segments.en: “Reverend Musila, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, do you know for yourself that
when continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases …
when grasping ceases, continued existence ceases …
when craving ceases, grasping ceases …
when feeling ceases, craving ceases …
when contact ceases, feeling ceases …
when the six sense fields cease, contact ceases …
when name and form cease, the six sense fields cease …
when consciousness ceases name and form cease …
when choices cease consciousness ceases …
when ignorance ceases, choices cease?”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
segments.en: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, I know and see that
when ignorance ceases, choices cease.”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso musila, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato musilassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
segments.en: “Reverend Musila, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, do you know for yourself that
the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment?”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
segments.en: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, I know and see that
the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment.”
“Then Venerable Musila is a perfected one, with defilements ended.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā musilo tuṇhī ahosi.
segments.en: When he said this, Musila kept silent.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā nārado āyasmantaṃ paviṭṭhaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Nārada said to Venerable Saviṭṭha,
“Reverend Saviṭṭha, please let me answer these questions.
Ask me
and I will answer them for you.”
“By all means, Venerable Nārada, try these questions.
I’ll ask you

segments.pli: Byākarotu ca me āyasmā nārado etaṃ pañhaṃ.
segments.en: and you can answer them for me.”

segments.pli: Aññatreva, āvuso nārada, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato nāradassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
segments.en: (Saviṭṭha repeats exactly the same series of questions, and Nārada answers just as Musila did.)

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
“Aññatreva, āvuso nārada, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato nāradassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ—
“Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
“Aññatreva, āvuso nārada, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato nāradassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
“Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
“Aññatreva, āvuso nārada, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato nāradassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
“Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
“Aññatreva, āvuso nārada, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā atthāyasmato nāradassa paccattameva ñāṇaṃ:
segments.en: “Reverend Nārada, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, do you know for yourself that
the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment?”

segments.pli: “Aññatreva, āvuso paviṭṭha, saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā ahametaṃ jānāmi ahametaṃ passāmi:
segments.en: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration, I know and see that
the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment.”
“Then Venerable Nārada is a perfected one, with defilements ended.”

segments.pli: “‘Bhavanirodho nibbānan’ti kho me, āvuso, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṃ, na camhi arahaṃ khīṇāsavo.
segments.en: “I have truly seen clearly with right wisdom that the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment. Yet I am not a perfected one.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, kantāramagge udapāno, tatra nevassa rajju na udakavārako.
segments.en: Suppose there was a well on a desert road that had neither rope nor bucket.

segments.pli: Atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito, so taṃ udapānaṃ olokeyya.
segments.en: Then along comes a person struggling in the oppressive heat, weary, thirsty, and parched.

segments.pli: Tassa ‘udakan’ti hi kho ñāṇaṃ assa, na ca kāyena phusitvā vihareyya.
segments.en: They’d know that there was water, but they couldn’t physically touch it.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, āvuso, ‘bhavanirodho nibbānan’ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṃ, na camhi arahaṃ khīṇāsavo”ti.
segments.en: In the same way, I have truly seen clearly with right wisdom that the cessation of continued existence is extinguishment. Yet I am not a perfected one.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā ānando āyasmantaṃ paviṭṭhaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Venerable Ānanda said to Venerable Saviṭṭha,

segments.pli: “evaṃvādī tvaṃ, āvuso paviṭṭha, āyasmantaṃ nāradaṃ kiṃ vadesī”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, what do you have to say to Venerable Nārada when he speaks like this?”

segments.pli: “Evaṃvādāhaṃ, āvuso ānanda, āyasmantaṃ nāradaṃ na kiñci vadāmi aññatra kalyāṇā aññatra kusalā”ti.
segments.en: “Reverend Ānanda, I have nothing to say to Venerable Nārada when he speaks like this, except what is good and wholesome.”

sections.title: At one time the venerables Musīla, Saviṭṭha, Nārada, and…

suttaplex.blurb: Venerable Saviṭṭha questions Venerable Musīla about his attainments, and concludes he is an arahant. But Venerable Nārada offers an explanation showing that it is possible to see the Dhamma without having fully realized arahantship.
